title: 2 Easy Ways to Set Your Status as Invisible on Discord

steps.title: Launch the Discord desktop app.
steps.content: Launch the Discord desktop app. Discord is available to download on Windows, Mac , and Linux. If you aren't already logged in, enter your email address and password to do so now. [1] X Research source You can also use Discord in a desktop browser at https://discord.com/ . Similar to appearing offline in Xbox and PlayStation consoles , you'll be able to use Discord without being visible to other users.

steps.title: Click your user ID.
steps.content: Click your user ID. This will be at the bottom-left corner. [2] X Research source A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Hover over your current status.
steps.content: Hover over your current status. You'll see this underneath your profile's About Me section. This can look like: Online , Idle , Do Not Disturb , or a custom status. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Invisible.
steps.content: Click Invisible . This is will at the bottom of the menu, next to a grey dot. You are now Invisible. You'll stay Invisible on all platforms until you change your status again. [3] X Research source Setting your status as Invisible allows you to stay logged in and use Discord without anyone knowing your activity status. You will not be visible to other users. If you type into a chat or server, others will still see (your username) is typing… before you send your message.

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. This looks like Discord's mascot, Wumpus, with a blue-purple background. Discord is available for iOS and Android.

steps.title: Tap ☰ in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap ☰ in the top-right corner. You can also swipe right to open the menu.

steps.title: Tap your user icon.
steps.content: Tap your user icon. This will be in the bottom-right corner. A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Set Status.
steps.content: Tap Set Status . This will show your current status, which can be: Online , Idle , Do Not Disturb , or a custom status. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Invisible.
steps.content: Tap Invisible . This is will at the bottom of the menu, next to a grey dot. You are now Invisible. You'll stay Invisible on all platforms until you change your status again. [4] X Research source Setting your status as Invisible allows you to stay logged in and use Discord without anyone knowing your activity status. [5] X Research source You can still chat in Discord and share your screen to specific users without anyone else seeing your activity. If you type into a chat or server, others will still see (your username) is typing… before you send your message.
